page.title: 07 Life in Grafton Underwood
page.content: Most people work in Kettering or on nearby farms. They travel by car. When people do not shop in the village shop they travel into Kettering. They have to go by car as there is only one bus each week and that is at 11.30 on Friday. It comes back in the early afternoon. There is no pub in the village. The nearest are at Slipton and Geddington, about 4 to 5 km away. Sometimes there are special events like dances and whist drives. There is a dance each Halloween. On Fridays some of the ladies go to the Womens Institute in the village. Some of the men do gardening or do some shooting. There is also a Young Farmers Club. Most people are happy living in Grafton Underwood and feel that it is a nice place to live.
